official-title.#text:
To authorize the Secretary of Education to establish the
		  National Program for Arts and Technology.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Education and the
			 Workforce

short-title.#text:
National Program for Arts and
			 Technology Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
established under this
			 Act will be one of the first national replication programs in the United States
			 dedicated to addressing the complex needs of the poor and undereducated by
			 improving the sustainability of neighborhoods, communities, and regions.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Program for Arts and Technology
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: National Program for Arts and Technology

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to provide competitive grants for
			 qualified centers and interested communities to establish a qualified center
			 that adopts the guidelines set forth by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Program for Arts and Technology
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: National Program for Arts and Technology

text.#text:
It is the purpose of this Act to establish
			 the

collaborating with
			 Federal agencies, private industry, nonprofit philanthropic organizations, and
			 planning and economic development organizations to leverage other investment
			 dollars on behalf of all stakeholders;

bridging the gap
			 between education and lifelong learning for poor performing students through
			 the discipline of craftsmanship in the visual arts; and

developing complimentary extended day or
			 year programming in partnership with the local public schools to help engage
			 at-risk students by connecting classroom instruction with applied and
			 experiential programming in the arts.
In this Act:

compliments the

is housed in a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to award grants, on a competitive
			 basis, to qualified centers and interested communities to—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Program for Arts and Technology
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: National Program for Arts and Technology

text.#text:
From the amounts
			 appropriated to carry out this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Program for Arts and Technology Act of 2013/s:2/ss:b

text.#text:
provide financial
			 support to the centers and communities to establish a new qualified center to
			 carry out the purposes described in

provide management
			 expertise to guide the centers and communities through the 3-phase replication
			 protocol developed by the Center of Origin to ensure standardization across all
			 qualified centers as to performance goals and objectives, operating culture,
			 and teaching models.

Federal funds
			 received under this Act may not be used for capital expenditures or endowment
			 gifts.

To be eligible to receive a grant under this Act, a
			 qualified center or interested community shall, for each fiscal year for which
			 the grant is received, provide non-Federal contributions (which may include
			 in-kind contributions) toward the amount of the grant in an amount equal to $1
			 for each $1 of Federal funds provided under the grant.
